title: 105_hr4404
content: The Act titled "Homebound Elderly Relief Opportunity Act of 1998" modifies home health services payment limits. The "Homebound Elderly Relief Opportunity Act of 1998" amends the Social Security Act to impose a moratorium on implementing per beneficiary limits under the interim payment system for home health services. The system only applies if aggregate expenditures exceed specified amounts for fiscal years 1998 and 1999. The Secretary will adjust payments to ensure total expenditures for home health services do not exceed $101 billion for fiscal years 1998 through 2002. The Homebound Elderly Relief Opportunity Act of 1998 imposes a moratorium on per beneficiary limits under the interim payment system for home health services. Section 1861(v)(1)(L) of the Act adjusts payments for outliers in costs by providing additional payments when the reasonable cost for home health services exceeds the limit by a fixed number of standard deviations, with a cap of 5 percent of projected payments. The Act is amended to adjust payment rules for home health agencies, including eliminating special per beneficiary payment rules and prorating limitations among agencies. New limits for fiscal year 1999 are published, taking into account the Homebound Elderly Relief Opportunity Act of 1998. The Homebound Elderly Relief Opportunity Act of 1998 requires the Secretary to establish limits within 90 days of the Act's enactment. SEC. 3. Modification of payment amount for home health services under the prospective payment system. Modification of payment amount for home health services under the prospective payment system includes establishing equitable limits for calculating rates and contingencies if the system is not implemented. The adjustment to cost limits for home health services before October 1, 2002 ensures payments do not exceed a specified amount, with a reduction of 15 percent if necessary. The Social Security Act amendment reduces cost limits for home health services by 15 percent for periods starting on or after October 1, 2002. The applicable amounts for fiscal years 2000, 2001, and 2002 are specified. Additionally, there is a temporary restoration of periodic interim payments for home health services. The Social Security Act amendment reduces cost limits for home health services by 15 percent starting on or after October 1, 2002, with specified amounts for fiscal years 2000, 2001, and 2002. There is also a temporary restoration of periodic interim payments for home health services until the end of the 12-month period following the implementation of the prospective payment system under section 1895. The amendments made by this Act will be effective as if included in the enactment of the Balanced Budget Act of 1997.
